e4: Adopting the new unbiased reporting policy will enhance transparency, build investor trust, and adhere to ethical financial reporting standards. It minimizes potential legal liability and aligns with future trends of more honest accounting practices. While immediate market reactions may vary, in the long run accurate reporting benefits firm reputation and governance.
e5: An ethical reporting policy principle includes accuracy, transparency, and fairness. Reports should provide true financial conditions without intentional obfuscation, ensuring that investors, both institutional and retail, receive equal and understandable information. Ethical considerations may also include proactive communication of changes to policy and respectful treatment of all stakeholders, recognizing situational impacts.
e6: How does the management team plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors to prevent confusion? And what steps will be taken to protect the interests of retail investors who may not readily perceive the policy transition? Additionally, how will the change potentially impact our relationships with regulatory bodies?
